decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thought Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils. It also uses powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to gain card advantage and control the board. The deck includes board wipes like Kaya's Wrath to clear the opponent's creatures, and spells like Command the Dreadhorde to bring back key creatures and planeswalkers from the graveyard. The deck also includes a few cards for specific matchups, such as Unmoored Ego for targeting specific cards in the opponent's deck.

The main goal of this Naya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast, aggressive creatures and efficient combat tricks. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Feather, the Redeemed and Dreadhorde Arcanist to continuously pump out threats while protecting them with spells like Gods Willing and Defiant Strike. By maintaining a strong board presence and constantly pressuring the opponent, this deck looks to quickly outpace and overpower the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to establish a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck focuses on using a combination of cheap instants and creatures to deal quick damage to the opponent. Cards like Shock and Reckless Rage provide direct damage, while Feather, the Redeemed allows for the reuse of instants. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Legion Warboss and Krenko, Tin Street Kingpin to generate additional threats on the battlefield. The aim is to overpower the opponent early on and maintain a steady stream of aggressive plays to secure victory.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on ramping up mana early with Llanowar Elves and Wildgrowth Walker, while using removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Noxious Grasp to control the board. Bolas's Citadel provides a powerful end-game threat, and cards like Find / Finality and Massacre Girl offer versatility in dealing with different types of threats. Nissa, Who Shakes the World can further ramp up mana and create large threats, while Karn, the Great Creator provides utility and disruption. The deck aims to swiftly overwhelm opponents with a mix of efficient creatures and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Golos, Tireless Pilgrim to disrupt opponent's strategies. It also ramps up its mana quickly with cards like Growth Spiral and Circuitous Route to cast big threats like Hydroid Krasis and generate value with cards like Drawn from Dreams. The deck's win condition revolves around utilizing Field of the Dead to create a horde of zombie tokens while also chaining extra turns with Nexus of Fate to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal, and planeswalkers. The deck focuses on maintaining board presence and disrupting the opponent's strategy through cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Kaya's Wrath. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Thought Erasure to help control the opponent's hand and resources. The inclusion of Command the Dreadhorde allows for a powerful late-game threat while also potentially gaining value from the opponent's graveyard.

The deck revolves around using Kethis, the Hidden Hand and Lazav, the Multifarious to combo off and mill cards with Diligent Excavator, while also utilizing the legendary creatures in the graveyard to generate value and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales help protect the combo pieces and provide card advantage. Using Mox Amber to ramp and control spells like Oath of Kaya, the deck aims to control the board and set up a game-winning combo using the graveyard as a resource.

This deck focuses on aggressive play and aims to quickly defeat the opponent. It capitalizes on the power of red cards and burn spells to deal direct damage to both the opponent and their creatures. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Viashino Pyromancer and Goblin Chainwhirler to control the board while dealing damage. Additionally, it takes advantage of cards like Experimental Frenzy and Chandra, Fire Artisan to maintain card advantage and continue the assault. The deck's strategy relies on fast and constant damage output to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays using powerful dinosaur creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards that allow for early mana ramp and card advantage, along with disruption and burn spells to keep opponents on the back foot. The key strategy is to play efficient threats like Marauding Raptor and Ripjaw Raptor, while also leveraging the unique abilities of cards like Shifting Ceratops and Rampaging Ferocidon. The deck aims to close out games quickly by maximizing its proactive game plan and applying pressure with its creature base.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through discard spells like Thought Erasure and counterspells. It also utilizes planeswalkers like Teferi to control the board and generate card advantage. The deck aims to control the game by removing threats with removal spells such as Vraska's Contempt and sweepers like Kaya's Wrath. It can also shut down opponents' card draw with Narset and gain card advantage with Search for Azcanta. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition and incremental advantages.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by using powerful planeswalkers such as Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler to dominate the board and disrupt your opponent's strategies. You can also control the board with cards like Oath of Kaya, Legion's End, and Kaya's Wrath, while also gaining card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes removal spells like Mortify and Tyrant's Scorn to deal with threats, making it difficult for your opponent to establish a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lazav, the Multifarious and Kethis, the Hidden Hand to create a powerful combo by filling up the graveyard with cards like Fblthp, the Lost and then using cards like Diligent Excavator to mill out the opponent and win the game with Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales provide control and card advantage, while Yawgmoth's Vile Offering and Oath of Kaya help in dealing with threats. Ashiok, Dream Render acts as graveyard hate and disruption against the opponent's strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to use cards like Lazav, Kethis, and Diligent Excavator to mill through the deck and set up powerful combos. By utilizing cards like Mox Amber and Teferi, Time Raveler to generate mana and control the board, the deck aims to grind down the opponent and eventually win through alternate win conditions like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries. With a mix of control elements and combo pieces, the deck looks to outvalue and outpace the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the abilities of Lazav, Kethis, and Diligent Excavator to combo off and mill through the deck quickly to find key pieces. Tamiyo, Teferi, and Ashiok provide control and card advantage, while Mox Amber helps accelerate mana production. The deck aims to set up a powerful board state quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of recursion, milling, and graveyard interactions. Overall, the deck focuses on assembling its combo pieces efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The key strategy of this deck is to utilize the combo of Wilderness Reclamation and Nexus of Fate to take infinite turns. By repeatedly untapping your lands during your end step with Wilderness Reclamation, you can generate a large amount of mana and continually cast Nexus of Fate to take extra turns. This allows you to outlast your opponent and potentially win the game through Jace, Wielder of Mysteries' alternate win condition. The deck also includes cards like Arboreal Grazer and Growth Spiral to ramp up your mana and draw additional cards, ensuring the combo can be executed consistently.

The main concept of this deck is focused on aggressive gameplay, using red spells and creatures to deal quick and direct damage to the opponent. The deck includes cards such as Chandra, Acolyte of Flame, Experimental Frenzy, Light Up the Stage, Lightning Strike, Shock, and Wizard's Lightning to efficiently deal damage. The deck also includes creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner, Scorch Spitter, Viashino Pyromancer, and Runaway Steam-Kin to provide additional damage sources. The deck also utilizes Mobilized District as a versatile land card. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and relentless aggression.
